snippet: The president reassured the leaders of labor and progressive groups that he will not cave to Congressional Republicans and extend Bush-era tax cuts for the wealthiest Americans.
abstract: Pres Obama reassures leaders of labor and progressive groups that he will not yield to Congressional Republicans and extend Bush-era tax cuts for the wealthiest Americans as he negotiates for a deficit-reduction plan to avoid looming tax increases and spending cuts.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and STEVEN GREENHOUSE
byline.contributor: Jackie Calmes reported from Washington, and Steven Greenhouse from New York.

lead_paragraph: The president reassured the leaders of labor and progressive groups that he will not cave to Congressional Republicans and extend Bush-era tax cuts for the wealthiest Americans.

headline.seo: Obama Tells Labor Leaders He’ll Stand Tough in Budget Talks
headline.main: Obama Vows Firm Stance on Deficit-Reduction Plan
headline.print_headline: Obama Vows Firm Stance On Deficit-Reduction Plan
